Summary: Three witnesses viewed five orbs and a V formation of flying wings in a span of 42 minutes.
divs: sighting details1. on tue 07\21\09 22:28 (clear night sky) i called my two daughters out to our melvindale, mi backyard to view a white star sized orb moving ene to ese (elv 70 deg to 110 deg) lasting 20 sec maximum. 2. during sighting #1 above one daughter exclaimed look dad: directly above (elv 80 deg to 100 deg) we saw a v shaped formation of white stubby flying wings or boomerangs facing n - total ~ six with one behind the apex near the formation's center. the boomerangs were bright and slightly beige with a darker outline. my daughter stated that at first sight the boomerang outlines were red. the formation was ~ 6" wide and 3" deep with each boomerang ~ the size of a sea gull at 200'. the formation moved behind a tree and disappeared after ~ 5-7 sec in view total (according to my daughter)! 3. then a large star sized orb (dime at arms length) moved w to e (elv 45 deg to 135 deg) ~ 20 sec and faded out. i called one daughter back outside to witness this also. 4. next we (one daughter and i) saw another white star sized orb moving due e (elv 90 deg to 135 deg) ~ 10 sec before it also faded out. the time was now 22:39. we then went inside to check spaceweather.com for satellite flybys for (42.3 lat., -83.2 long.): iss 10:31:50 pm wnw 10:34:13 51��� note that sighting #3 was too short of duration to match the iss flyby. 5. i then went again to the backyard at 23:09 and saw a white star sized orb moving ene to ese (80 deg to 135 deg) which sped up before fading out ~ 10 sec (one daughter also witnessed) 6. finally, at 23:11 my two daughters called me to view a large orange\white star sized orb (elv 45 deg) moving n to e that faded out after ~ 5 sec. one daughter stated that the orb at first sight blinked two red lights then remained a steady color of orange \ white. for sightings #4-#6 some light clouds drifted in but did not affect our views.
trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Melvindale
